quotes.quote: A great power imposes the obligation of exercising restraint, and we did not live up to this obligation. I think this affected many of the scientists in a subtle sense, and it diminished their desire to continue to work on the bomb.
quotes.author: Leo Szilard

quotes.quote: If we focus our attention on the next twenty-five years we may say that development is likely to reach some point intermediate between the first bomb detonated over Hiroshima and processes which once initiated might put an end to all life on earth. Just what intermediate point will be reached within twenty-five years no one can tell.
quotes.author: Leo Szilard

quotes.quote: I'm looking for a market for wisdom.
quotes.author: Leo Szilard

quotes.quote: A scientist's aim in a discussion with his colleagues is not to persuade, but to clarify.
quotes.author: Leo Szilard

quotes.quote: The most important step in getting a job done is the recognition of the problem. Once I recognize a problem I usually can think of someone who can work it out better than I could.
quotes.author: Leo Szilard

quotes.quote: Every kind of science, if it has only reached a certain degree of maturity, automatically becomes a part of mathematics.
quotes.author: David Hilbert

quotes.quote: Nobody should be able to drive us out of the paradise that Cantor created for us.
quotes.author: David Hilbert

quotes.quote: The art of doing mathematics consists in finding that special case which contains all the germs of generality.
quotes.author: David Hilbert

quotes.quote: One can measure the importance of a scientific work by the number of earlier publications rendered superfluous by it.
quotes.author: David Hilbert

quotes.quote: Mathematics knows no races or geographic boundaries; for mathematics, the cultural world is one country.
quotes.author: David Hilbert

quotes.quote: What if sometimes there is no choice about what to love? What if the temple comes to Mohammed? What if you just love? without deciding? You just do: you see her and in that instant are lost to sober account-keeping and cannot choose but to love?
quotes.author: David Foster Wallace

quotes.quote: My chest bumps like a dryer with shoes in it.
quotes.author: David Foster Wallace

quotes.quote: Severity is in the eye of the sufferer, it says. Pain is pain.
quotes.author: David Foster Wallace

quotes.quote: After a few weeks of this she'd spend a whole day weeping, beating at herself as if on fire.
quotes.author: David Foster Wallace

quotes.quote: Betraying her class and origin with the heartbreaking openness Joelle's always viewed as either terribly stupid or terribly brave
quotes.author: David Foster Wallace

quotes.quote: I discovered that reading is a servile way of dreaming. If I have to dream, why not dream my own dreams?
quotes.author: Fernando Pessoa

quotes.quote: The essence of the universe is contradiction.
quotes.author: Fernando Pessoa

quotes.quote: Every man who deserves to be famous knows that it is not worth being famous.
quotes.author: Fernando Pessoa

quotes.quote: If, after I die, you want to write my biography, There is nothing simpler. There are only two dates—the date of my birth and the date of my death. Between one thing and another, every day is mine.
quotes.author: Fernando Pessoa

quotes.quote: Ah, to be able to be you, being me! To have your joyful unconsciousness, And the awareness of it!
quotes.author: Fernando Pessoa

quotes.quote: To tell the truth, to arrive together at the truth, is a communist and revolutionary act.
quotes.author: Antonio Gramsci

quotes.quote: History teaches, but it has no pupils.
quotes.author: Antonio Gramsci

quotes.quote: For two years I have lived outside the world: in a dream world. One by one, I let each strand tying me to the world and to my fellow men be cut. I live entirely for the mind, for the heart not at all …. I turned myself into a bear, inside and outside … other people did not exist for me. For perhaps two years, I didn’t laugh once and I didn’t cry … but I never hurt anyone but myself.
quotes.author: Antonio Gramsci

quotes.quote: I’m a pessimist because of intelligence, but an optimist because of will.
quotes.author: Antonio Gramsci

quotes.quote: The crisis consists precisely in the fact that the old dies and the new cannot be born: in this interregnum the most varied morbid phenomena occur.
quotes.author: Antonio Gramsci

quotes.quote: It seems to me as good as certain that we cannot get the upper hand against England. The English — the best race in the world
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
quotes.source: cannot lose! We, however, can lose and shall lose, if not this year then next year. The thought that our race is going to be beaten depresses me terribly, because I am completely German.

quotes.quote: I work quite diligently and wish that I were better and smarter. And these both are one and the same.
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.quote: It is necessary to be given the prop that all elementary props are given. This is not necessary because it is even impossible. There is no such prop! That all elementary props are given is SHOWN by there being none having an elementary sense which is not given.
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.quote: One often makes a remark and only later sees how true it is.
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.quote: Logic takes care of itself; all we have to do is to look and see how it does it.
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.quote: It is worth pausing for a moment to consider how far our conclusions are affected by considerations which our simplifying assumptions have forced us to neglect.
quotes.author: Frank P. Ramsey

quotes.quote: Philosophy must be of some use and we must take it seriously; it must clear our thoughts and so our actions. Or else it is a disposition that we have to check, and an inquiry to see that this is so; i.e. the chief proposition of philosophy is that philosophy is nonsense. And again we must then take seriously that it is nonsense, and not pretend, as Wittgenstein does, that it is important nonsense!
quotes.author: Frank P. Ramsey

quotes.quote: The formalists neglected the content altogether and made mathematics meaningless, the logicians neglected the form and made mathematics consist of any true generalizations; only by taking account of both sides and regarding it as composed of tautologous generalizations can we obtain an adequate theory.
quotes.author: Frank P. Ramsey

quotes.quote: Get it into your thick head that jokes are just like life. Things that begin badly, end badly. Everything's fine in the middle, it's the end you need to worry about.
quotes.author: László Krasznahorkai

quotes.quote: Why should things be easy to understand?
quotes.author: Thomas Pynchon

quotes.quote: My belief is that recluse is a code word generated by journalists... meaning, doesn't like to talk to reporters.
quotes.author: Thomas Pynchon

quotes.quote: Here's your quote: Thomas Pynchon loved this book, almost as much as he loves cameras! Hey, over here! Have your picture taken with a reclusive author! Today only, we'll throw in a free autograph! But wait, there's more!
quotes.author: Thomas Pynchon

quotes.quote: It was indeed a great day not only for the Sikhs but also for the whole of India when Guru Govinda, defying the age-long conventions of the Hindu society, made his followers one, by breaking down all barriers of caste and thereby made them free to inherit the true blessings of a self-respecting manhood. Sikhism has a brave message to the people and it has a noble record.
quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.quote: I cannot but bring to your mind those days when the whole of Eastern Asia, from Burma to Japan was united with India in the closest ties of friendship...
quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.quote: The butterfly counts not months but moments, and has time enough.
quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.quote: I believe there is no philosophical high
quotes.author: Max Born
quotes.source: road in science, with epistemological signposts. No, we are in a jungle and find our way by trial and error, building our road behind us as we proceed. We do not find signposts at crossroads, but our own scouts erect them, to help the rest.

quotes.quote: If God has made the world a perfect mechanism, He has at least conceded so much to our imperfect intellect that in order to predict little parts of it, we need not solve innumerable differential equations, but can use dice with fair success.
quotes.author: Max Born

quotes.quote: Intellect distinguishes between the possible and the impossible; reason distinguishes between the sensible and the senseless. Even the possible can be senseless.
quotes.author: Max Born

quotes.quote: I am now convinced that theoretical physics is actually philosophy. It has revolutionized fundamental concepts, e.g., about space and time (relativity), about causality (quantum theory), and about substance and matter (atomistics). It has taught us new methods of thinking (complementarity), which are applicable far beyond physics.
quotes.author: Max Born

quotes.quote: The continuity of our science has not been affected by all these turbulent happenings, as the older theories have always been included as limiting cases in the new ones.
quotes.author: Max Born

quotes.quote: There is no God and Dirac is his prophet.
quotes.author: Wolfgang Pauli

quotes.quote: I have done a terrible thing, I have postulated a particle that cannot be detected.
quotes.author: Wolfgang Pauli

quotes.quote: Already in my original paper I stressed the circumstance that I was unable to give a logical reason for the exclusion principle or to deduce it from more general assumptions. I had always the feeling, and I still have it today, that this is a deficiency.
quotes.author: Wolfgang Pauli

quotes.quote: Later, however, I came to recognize the objective nature of these dreams or fantasies … Thus it was that I gradually came to acknowledge that such fantasies or dreams are neither meaningless nor purely arbitrary but rather convey a sort of second meaning of the terms applied.
quotes.author: Wolfgang Pauli

quotes.quote: The layman always means, when he says reality that he is speaking of something self-evidently known; whereas to me it seems the most important and exceedingly difficult task of our time is to work on the construction of a new idea of reality.
quotes.author: Wolfgang Pauli

quotes.quote: [M]athematicians and physicists think alike; they are led, and sometimes misled, by the same patterns of plausible reasoning.
quotes.author: George Pólya

quotes.quote: Mathematics is the cheapest science. Unlike physics or chemistry, it does not require any expensive equipment. All one needs for mathematics is a pencil and paper.
quotes.author: George Pólya

quotes.quote: There was a seminar for advanced students in Zürich that I was teaching and von Neumann was in the class. I came to a certain theorem, and I said it is not proved and it may be difficult. Von Neumann didn't say anything but after five minutes he raised his hand. When I called on him he went to the blackboard and proceeded to write down the proof. After that I was afraid of von Neumann.
quotes.author: George Pólya

quotes.quote: Analogy pervades all our thinking, our everyday speech and our trivial conclusions as well as artistic ways of expression and the highest scientific achievements.
quotes.author: George Pólya

quotes.quote: Euclid's manner of exposition, progressing relentlessly from the data to the unknown and from the hypothesis to the conclusion, is perfect for checking the argument in detail but far from being perfect for making understandable the main line of the argument.
quotes.author: George Pólya

quotes.quote: In mathematics, perhaps more than in any other branch of knowledge, ideas spring fully armed from the creator's brain; thus mathematical talent usually reveals itself at a young age; and second-rate researchers play a smaller role than elsewhere, the role of a sounding board for a sound they do not contribute to shape.
quotes.author: André Weil

quotes.quote: God exists since mathematics is consistent, and the Devil exists since we cannot prove it.
quotes.author: André Weil

quotes.quote: An important point is that the p-adic field, or respectively the real or complex field, corresponding to a prime ideal, plays exactly the role, in arithmetic, that the field of power series in the neighborhood of a point plays in the theory of functions: that is why one calls it a local field.
quotes.author: André Weil

quotes.quote: We should ask our fellow physicists to invent a principle of anti
quotes.author: André Weil
quotes.source: interference, which would bring light out of two obscurities (Leray and Grothendieck).

quotes.quote: Irrationality is the square root of all evil.
quotes.author: Douglas Hofstadter

quotes.quote: Which statement seems more true: (1) I have a brain. (2) I am a brain.
quotes.author: Douglas Hofstadter

quotes.quote: In fact, a sense of essence is, in essence, the essence of sense, in effect.
quotes.author: Douglas Hofstadter

quotes.quote: The nice thing about having a brain is that one can learn, that ignorance can be supplanted by knowledge, and that small bits of knowledge can gradually pile up into substantial heaps.
quotes.author: Douglas Hofstadter

quotes.quote: The public has a distorted view of science, because children are taught in school that science is a collection of firmly established truths. In fact, science is not a collection of truths. It is a continuing exploration of mysteries.
quotes.author: Freeman Dyson

quotes.quote: I am acutely aware of the fact that the marriage between mathematics and physics, which was so enormously fruitful in past centuries, has recently ended in divorce.
quotes.author: Freeman Dyson

quotes.quote: Thirty-one years ago [1948], Dick Feynman told me about his sum over histories version of quantum mechanics. The electron does anything it likes, he said. It just goes in any direction at any speed, forward or backward in time, however it likes, and then you add up the amplitudes and it gives you the wave
quotes.author: Freeman Dyson
quotes.source: function. I said to him, You're crazy. But he wasn't.

quotes.quote: As we look out into the Universe and identify the many accidents of physics and astronomy that have worked together to our benefit, it almost seems as if the Universe must in some sense have known that we were coming.
quotes.author: Freeman Dyson

quotes.quote: The bottom line for mathematicians is that the architecture has to be right. In all the mathematics that I did, the essential point was to find the right architecture. It's like building a bridge. Once the main lines of the structure are right, then the details miraculously fit. The problem is the overall design.
quotes.author: Freeman Dyson

quotes.quote: … Dr. Lightman was an astrophysicist, a card
quotes.author: Alan Lightman
quotes.source: carrying wizard of space and time, with a Ph.D. from the California Institute of Technology and subsequent posts at Cornell and Harvard. In 1989, at the peak of his prowess as a physicist, he began to walk away from the world of black holes to enter the world of black ink and the uncertain, lonely life of the writer.

quotes.quote: I do wish I believed in the life eternal, for it makes me quite miserable to think man is merely a kind of machine endowed, unhappily for himself, with consciousness.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: The fundamental cause of the trouble is that in the modern world the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Most people would sooner die than think; in fact, they do so.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: I am looking forward very much to getting back to Cambridge, and being able to say what I think and not to mean what I say: two things which at home are impossible. Cambridge is one of the few places where one can talk unlimited nonsense and generalities without anyone pulling one up or confronting one with them when one says just the opposite the next day.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Thee will find out in time that I have a great love of professing vile sentiments, I don't know why, unless it springs from long efforts to avoid priggery.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: The scholar worthy of the name, especially the geometer, experiences the same impression when faced with his work as the artist; his enjoyment is as great and of the same nature.
quotes.author: Henri Poincaré

quotes.quote: It is even simple hypotheses that we must challenge the most, because they are the ones that are most likely to go unnoticed.
quotes.author: Henri Poincaré

quotes.quote: The task of the educator is to make the child's mind go through what that of his fathers went through, going quickly through certain stages but not eliminating any of them. On this account, the history of science must be our guide.
quotes.author: Henri Poincaré

quotes.quote: We do not have and cannot have any means of discovering whether or not we are carried along in a uniform motion of translation.
quotes.author: Henri Poincaré

quotes.quote: Everyone believes in it, however, Mr. Lippmann told me one day, because experimenters imagine that it is a mathematical theorem, and mathematicians that it is an experimental fact.
quotes.author: Henri Poincaré

quotes.quote: Personally, people know themselves very poorly.
quotes.author: Ernst Mach

quotes.quote: In reality, the law always contains less than the fact itself, because it does not reproduce the fact as a whole but only in that aspect of it which is important for us, the rest being intentionally or from necessity omitted.
quotes.author: Ernst Mach

quotes.quote: There is no problem in all mathematics that cannot be solved by direct counting. But with the present implements of mathematics many operations can be performed in a few minutes which without mathematical methods would take a lifetime.
quotes.author: Ernst Mach

quotes.quote: Not bodies produce sensations, but element-complexes (sensation-complexes) constitute the bodies. When the physicist considers the bodies as the permanent reality, the `elements' as the transient appearance, he does not realise that all `bodies' are only mental symbols for element-complexes (sensation-complexes)
quotes.author: Ernst Mach

quotes.quote: The mental operation by which one achieves new concepts and which one denotes generally by the inadequate name of induction is not a simple but rather a very complicated process. Above all, it is not a logical process although such processes can be inserted as intermediary and auxiliary links. The principle effort that leads to the discovery of new knowledge is due to abstraction and imagination.
quotes.author: Ernst Mach

quotes.quote: My methods are really methods of working and thinking; this is why they have crept in everywhere anonymously.
quotes.author: Emmy Noether

quotes.quote: Ich habe das symbolische Rechnen mit Stumpf und Stil verlernt.I have completely forgotten the symbolic calculus.
quotes.author: Emmy Noether

quotes.quote: If one proves the equality of two numbers a and b by showing first that a ≦ b and then that a ≧ b , it is unfair; one should instead show that they are really equal by disclosing the inner ground for their equality.
quotes.author: Emmy Noether

quotes.quote: A ring of polynomials in any number of variables over a ring of coeffcients that has an identity element and a finite basis, itself has a finite basis.
quotes.author: Emmy Noether

quotes.quote: [Noether] taught us to think in terms of simple and general algebraic concepts—homomorphic mappings, groups and rings with operators, ideals—and not in cumbersome algebraic computations; and she thereby opened up the path to finding algebraic principles in places where such principles had been obscured by some complicated special situation.
quotes.author: Emmy Noether
